mods.abstract: A Runaway in Jail. Was committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 30th May last, a negroman calling himself ISAAC, aged about 45 years, five feet, 9 inches high, having had the thumb of the left hand cut off. Isaac says he belongs to Mr. Ogden, residing on Bayour BÅ“uf, in the Parish of St. Landry, from whom he runaway on the 26th of May. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, June 3rd, 1854. 03

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
